data.text:
𝐌𝐚𝐥𝐚𝐲𝐬𝐢𝐚 𝐄𝐦𝐞𝐫𝐠𝐞𝐬 𝐚𝐬 𝐒𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐠𝐢𝐜 𝐇𝐮𝐛 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐆𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐧 𝐌𝐚𝐜𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐞 𝐓𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐈𝐧𝐝𝐮𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐲 The German machine tool industry is expanding its global footprint despite pandemic challenges like delivery difficulties and market lockdowns. On July 10, 2024, the VDW (German Machine Tool Builders' Association) held the "Innovations in Production Technology – German Machine Tools Symposium" in Kuala Lumpur. This event aimed to strengthen German manufacturers' presence in emerging markets like Malaysia, highlighting the country's potential as a key sales market in the ASEAN region. Malaysia is set to become a crucial hub for German production technology, with the government focusing on enhancing domestic value and creating high-quality jobs. At the symposium, eight leading German tech companies, including DMG MORI, Chiron, Grob, Hermle, Index, Open Mind Technologies, SCHÜTTE, and United Grinding Group, engaged with 110 Malaysian trade visitors. They showcased their products and services and participated in 48 B2B meetings, exploring opportunities in aerospace, electronics, electrical engineering, and medical technology sectors. Click on the comments section to read the report: Klaus-Peter Kuhnmuench | Tara Méité | Oliver Prpic | Roland Merz #GermanEngineering #MachineTools #MalaysiaTech #IndustryExpansion #ASEANMarkets

Last week, we published the mid-year scorecard, presenting a review of the total number of patents published in the first half of 2024. Continuing our analysis, we are back with more amazing insights, spotlighting the players leading the innovation race across top geographies, including China, the USA, and Japan. Eager for more? Dive into our report card for a comprehensive exploration of these insights and beyond! 🌐✨ #PatentTrends #InnovationInsights #TechBreakthroughs #IPStrategy #MidYearReview #TechInnovation #IndustryInsights #Samsung #Toyota #LG #Canon #Haier #Mitsubishi #Bosch #Mercedes #China #USA #India #Patent #Innovation #PatentLandscape #Invent #Protect

🌟 Unlock the Threefold Advantages of TAI-TECH's Common Mode Filters 🌟 📢 We're thrilled to present our Common Mode Filters—a game-changer in electronic applications! #ProductionCapacity #ManufacturingProcess #ServiceExcellence 🏭Production Capacity🏭 With a whopping capacity of 450kk/month, we're equipped to meet your demands with ease. But that's not all! Stay tuned for an exciting update—our additional COO in Malaysia is coming soon, further enhancing our production capabilities. Plus, rest assured with our short and controllable lead times, ensuring your projects stay on track! 🔧Manufacturing Process🔧 Our approach to manufacturing is all about vertical integration, guaranteeing unmatched quality and reliability. With a manufacturing partner in Taiwan boasting over 20 years of expertise, coupled with a remarkable over 95% acceptance rate to TDK and Murata, you can trust in the excellence of our Common Mode Filters. 💼Service Excellence💼 Service excellence is at the heart of everything we do at TAI-TECH. Benefit from our multi-location service coverage, ensuring prompt and responsive assistance whenever you need it. Have unique requirements? No problem! Our team offers design flexibility and customization options to tailor our Common Mode Filters to your specific needs. 💥Elevate your electronic applications with TAI-TECH's Common Mode Filters—where quality meets reliability meets service excellence! 💥 #TAITECH #CommonModeFilters #Electronics #Innovation #ServiceExcellence #Manufacturing #TechSolutions

📢 Exciting news: On January 1st, 2024, many Daifuku Group companies around the world, particularly those in the US, will be renamed, unifying them with the Daifuku name. This development will firmly establish the Daifuku name within all the countries and regions where we operate and further unite the Daifuku Group. ☛Check out the release on the Daifuku website to see more details on the changes. https://lnkd.in/gCT9Ahwv #BusinessNews #MaterialHandling #DaifukuTeam

📈 Thailand's Board of Investment has reported a significant 31% increase in investment application value for the first quarter of 2024, totaling USD6.2 billion. 🔌 The electronics sector led the investment charge, focusing on printed circuit boards (PCB), wafer fabrication, and smart electronic products, closely followed by the automotive, petrochemical, and chemical sectors. ↗ During this period, a total of 724 project applications were submitted, marking a substantial 94% increase from the previous year's first quarter, with 460 involving foreign direct investment (FDI), up 130%, with significant contributions from Singapore, China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, and Australia. 📍 Moreover, the Eastern Economic Corridor Area (EEC), a specially designated economic zone in Thailand, attracted 279 investment applications. 🚩 For those keen on exploring investment opportunities in Thailand, AMATA presents unparalleled possibilities, boasting the region's largest industrial estate and supply chain in the EEC area. Reach out to us to learn more. For more on the full press release: https://lnkd.in/gCFSS3t2 #thailand #boi #investment #manufacturing #electronics #

Not everything can always work out. Sometimes a plant has to close again. I don’t know why exactly the Wieland plant in Serbia has to close. Wieland Cacak seems to face severe economic challenges (shrinking turnover?) and escalating operational costs (operating and logistics). To make a success of a new plant, there are a few things to consider. One important point is the selection of the location with a site selection consultant. This can record the company’s requirements and find the best possible location. Professionals should be involved in setting up and transferring production - internally or externally. We are there for your relocation project - for the strategic site selection and the production transfer. Factory Location Scouting #serbia #siteselection #CEE #manufacturing

In the realm of technological advancement and manufacturing excellence, few experiences are as enlightening as witnessing the intricate processes behind cutting-edge technology. Recently, I had the distinct pleasure of visiting the JKUAT Industrial Park, a hub of innovation and precision, to explore the operations of the Taifa Laptop and Tablet Assembly. This visit, meticulously organized by JHUB Africa, offered an in-depth look into the sophisticated world of laptop and tablet manufacturing, showcasing a harmonious blend of advanced technology, rigorous quality control, and skilled craftsmanship. This report delves into the heart of the assembly plant, revealing how each component, process, and team effort contributes to the creation of high-quality devices that drive education, governance, and progress. Click the link below to read more on this ;

https://lnkd.in/g47XW6EX ASE spent NT$464 million to acquire land in Penang, Malaysia to expand advanced packaging production capacity. > Semiconductor packaging and testing factory ASE Investment Holdings announced today (19th) afternoon that its Malaysian subsidiary invested RM69.696 million (approximately NT$464 million) to obtain the land use rights of Guihua City Technology Park in Penang State, Malaysia, to meet operational needs. > ASE Semiconductor, a subsidiary of ASE Investment Holdings, is actively expanding the production capacity of its Malaysian packaging and testing plant. In November 2022, the fourth and fifth new factories in Penang, Malaysia, broke ground and are expected to be completed in 2025. ASE pointed out at the time that it would invest US$300 million within five years to expand its footprint in Malaysia. Production plants, purchasing advanced equipment, training and cultivating more engineering talents. #ASE #malaysia #Semiconductorindustry #electronics #semiconductor #supplychain #manufacturingtechnology #processtechnology #engineering #manufacturing #technology #computerchips #business #innovation #semiconductors #chips #chipmaker #foundry credit: technews-tw

[Nidec’s strength in mass production] The Nidec Group provides high-quality products and modules, mainly motors, to customers around the world. In order to mass-produce high-quality products and modules with the same quality in any country, advanced technologies and production facilities are necessary. This video shows how we realize a high-level production system on a global scale along with an explanation by Onishi, the executive in charge of production. Please check it out!
